intro: Oyedaea acuminata, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and savannas. Oyedaea acuminata is adapted to arid conditions and has a shallow root system to maximize water absorption.
